item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 27, 2025 at 4:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. FromSoft's singular mech game Chromehounds is back online (90 points | 13 comments)
2. CSS Minecraft (492 points | 53 comments)
3. Yes-rs: A fast, memory-safe rewrite of the classic Unix yes command (44 points | 25 comments)
4. Accessing private GitHub repositories via MCP (94 points | 23 comments)
5. Lossless video compression using Bloom filters (211 points | 83 comments)
6. Power Failure (80 points | 29 comments)
7. Clojure MCP (9 points | discuss)
8. Trying to teach in the age of the AI homework machine (145 points | 218 comments)
9. Highlights from the Claude 4 system prompt (78 points | 23 comments)
10. Get PC BIOS back on UEFI only system (83 points | 29 comments)
11. Grammars of Formal Uncertainty (9 points | 1 comment)
12. A new class of materials that can passively harvest water from air (333 points | 153 comments)
13. Show HN: PgDog – Shard Postgres without extensions (195 points | 43 comments)
14. Calendars, Contacts and Files in Stalwart (23 points | 2 comments)
15. TSMC bets on unorthodox optical tech (140 points | 60 comments)
16. Owls in Towels (377 points | 28 comments)
17. SVG Favicons in Action (37 points | 3 comments)

19. Launch HN: Nomi (YC X25) – Copilot for Sales (71 points | 61 comments)
20. The Difference Between Downloading and Streaming (86 points | 50 comments)
21. TIL: timeout in Bash scripts (264 points | 73 comments)
22. Forester, a tool for scientific and mathematical hypertexts (11 points | 1 comment)
23. Iron Spring PL/I Compiler (36 points | 15 comments)
24. Like a hot dog, the Wienermobile is made from a variety of ingredients (2022) (8 points | 3 comments)
25. Changelog: Lazy trees (faster Nix builds) (48 points | 3 comments)
26. Particle Life simulation in browser using WebGPU (170 points | 54 comments)
27. WavePhoenix – open-source implementation of the Nintendo WaveBird protocol (103 points | 11 comments)
28. New DSL "MassQL" lets scientists query mass spectrometry data (14 points | 8 comments)
29. Hacker News now runs on top of Common Lisp (473 points | 269 comments)
30. Creating Debian packages from upstream Git (86 points | 12 comments)
